meanings.definition: Not favoring or advocating progress or reform
meanings.sent1: The nonprogressives group resisted any changes to the traditional methods.
meanings.sent2: She always felt more comfortable with the nonprogressives ideas.
meanings.sent3: The nonprogressives at the meeting joked about using typewriters instead of computers.
meanings.sent4: The old building stood as a symbol of the nonprogressives mindset in the town.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn attitude of the nonprogressives was evident in their refusal to adapt.

meanings.definition: A person who is not in favor of progress or reform
meanings.sent1: The nonprogressives were vocal about their opposition to the new policies.
meanings.sent2: He was known as a nonprogressives due to his resistance to change.
meanings.sent3: The nonprogressives in the group teased each other about being stuck in the past.
meanings.sent4: She saw the nonprogressives as anchors holding back the community's growth.
meanings.sent5: The nonprogressives' presence was a reminder of the importance of open-mindedness.
